page.title: 10LOCAL GOVERNMENT,WITHERNSEA
page.content: Withernsea used to have a great deal of local autonomy but with local government reorganisation much power has been lost.Only recently has the town received parish council status. The police station is centrally situated but is not continually manned and during non-office hours calls are routed to Hull.There is however community policing. In education the 3 schools are adjacent.There is an infants school for ages 5-7,a junior school for ages 7-11,and a secondary comprehensive high school for 11-18.The high school claims to be the country's first purpose built comprehensive being established in 1957.The Institute of FE,based in the high school, provides a range of activities during day and evening and the high school 6th form centre doubles as a YC.
